text.*:
A Bachelor of Environmental Science is an undergraduate bachelor's degree awarded for courses taken in the study of environmental science or related disciplines, such as sustainable resource development, environmental health, or ecological sustainability, and may also be known as a Bachelor of Environmental Science and Management degree in some schools. This is a interdisciplinary degree course, some universities offers four year honors degree programme

The Bachelor of Environmental Science degree is frequently abbreviated as B.Env.Sc., (sometimes B.E.Sc, B.S.E.S, or even B.E.S - the latter of which can cause confusion with a Bachelor of Environmental Studies degree) especially in the use of post-nominals where an Environmental Studies degree may be either B.S. or B.A.

In Australia, those who graduate with a B.Env.Sc. are eligible for membership in the Environment Institute of Australian and New Zealand.

Contents

  • 1 List of institutions awarding Bachelor of Environmental Science degrees

      • 1.1.1 Canada

List of institutions awarding Bachelor of Environmental Science degrees[edit]

This listing only includes institutions that award a Bachelor of Environmental Science degree. Although there are similar programs that are Bachelor of Science degrees that specialize in Environmental Science or Environmental Studies, they are not included in this list. In many cases, the differences are political or administrative in nature, as opposed to content.

North America[edit]

Canada[edit]

  • Mount Allison University [1]
  • Lakehead University[2]
  • Queen's University[3]
  • Trent University (formally a Bachelor of Environmental Studies and Science degree)[4]
  • University of Guelph[5]
  • University of Manitoba[6]
  • University of Waterloo[7]

  • University of Phoenix[8]
  • Humboldt State University[9]
  • Indiana University Purdue University Indianapolis[10]
  • California State University, Chico[11]
  • Eastern Michigan University[12]
  • Portland State University[13]
  • American Military University[14]
  • American Public University[15]
  • University of Tampa[16]

Australia[edit]

  • Australian Catholic University[17]
  • Central Queensland University[18]
  • Charles Darwin University[19]
  • Charles Stuart University[20]
  • Deakin University[21]
  • Griffith University[22]
  • Monash University[23]
  • RMIT University[24]
  • Southern Cross University[25]
  • University of Canberra[26]
  • University of Newcastle (Australia)[27]
  • University of New England (Australia)[28]
  • University of Queensland[29]
  • University of South Australia[30]
  • University of Tasmania[31]
  • University of the Sunshine Coast[32]
  • University of Wollongong[33]

Africa[edit]

  • Kenyatta University[34]
  • Pwani University[35]
  • Uganda Christian University[36]
  • University of Buea
  • University of Venda
  • Kisii University
  • Tanzania (ardhi university as BSc. Esm)

Asia[edit]

  • University of Peradeniya[37]
  • Universiti Putra Malaysia[38]
  • Partido State University (Philippines)
  • University of the Philippines (Philippines)
  • Technological University of the Philippines (Philippines)
  • Bulacan State University (Philippines)
  • Thai Nguyen University of Agriculture and Forestry (Vietnam)
  • International Islamic University Islamabad, Pakistan[39]
  • Kathmandu University, Dhulikhel, Nepal

Other[edit]

  • University of Fiji[40]
